neighborhoods.name: Plaka
neighborhoods.description: Charming pedestrian streets beneath the Acropolis with neoclassical architecture, traditional tavernas, and ancient ruins around every corner. The oldest neighborhood in Athens.

neighborhoods.name: Monastiraki
neighborhoods.description: Bustling flea market, street food, and lively atmosphere. Home to the famous Monastiraki Square with views of the Acropolis and ancient Agora.

neighborhoods.name: Syntagma
neighborhoods.description: Athens' main square, home to the Parliament building and changing of the guard. Excellent metro connections and upscale shopping on Ermou Street.

neighborhoods.name: Kolonaki
neighborhoods.description: Athens' most fashionable neighborhood with designer boutiques, art galleries, and sophisticated cafes. At the foot of Lycabettus Hill.

neighborhoods.name: Psyrri
neighborhoods.description: Former industrial area transformed into Athens' creative hub. Street art, indie bars, live music venues, and eclectic restaurants.

neighborhoods.name: Koukaki
neighborhoods.description: Quiet residential neighborhood just south of the Acropolis. Local tavernas, neighborhood feel, and excellent value. The locals' favorite.

neighborhoods.name: Exarchia
neighborhoods.description: Athens' anarchist and student quarter. Cheap eats, vinyl shops, and alternative culture. Not for everyone, but full of character.

neighborhoods.name: Piraeus
neighborhoods.description: Athens' historic port city. Perfect for early ferry departures to the islands. Seafood restaurants along the marina and authentic Greek atmosphere.
